g.text: It is the default server that runs .Net
It assign a ports to the web app
It can be application server that
but It is best to use reverse proxy
It predefines a super Set that how your application
Its terms are available to the entire web application
It has three default names: Development, Staging,
Staging: the application runs on a server, from
which other developers and quality controllers
Production: When application 'live' on the internet

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 226px; height: 1px; padding-top: 4745px; margin-left: 4757px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 25px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

g.text: A middleware is a code block(method) that
It uses Single Responsibility Principle where
each middleware only handles one problem
It is either a anonymous function or a lambda
Middlewares chain together to form application
To add a middleware to the pipeline, we use
One thing to note that execution of request is
from top to bottom, but result is from bottom to
Oder of calling the middleware matters
Run() adds a middleware to the pipeline
the function pass to app.Run() is a middleware
that only execute when receiving request
However, app will not allow chaining by
forwarding request to the next middleware
It is the termination of middleware, so it runs at
Use() also adds a middleware to the pipeline
It allows passing of the request to the next mid
// this part is executed in bottom-up process
RequestDelegate is a delegate that pass down
the HttpContext to the next middleware
Note that the code after next(ctx) will execute
when all the middleware in the subsequence
And it is optional to call next()
When a middleware getting larger, it is best to
seperate it to a class file
It inherits from Imiddleware Interface, and must
In the main program file where you create the
builder, you need to add your middleware to it
It adds the Custom Middleware to the pipeline
We can create Middleware Extension method
which is inherited by WebApplication Class that
holds the entire web application, and an instance
of this class is 'app' we created in the begining
It adds the Custom Middleware to the pipeline
This is the new official way of creating custom middleware
// Call the next delegate/middleware in the pipeline.
In the same file, create another class that inject this
It adds the Custom Middleware to the pipeline
It is a function of WebApplication class
that add middleware to the Middleware
It execute middleware if the condition is meet
It takes in two function parameters, first returns
a boolean to see if the condition is ture; second
param is a builder that execute middleware
It enables the app to use Rouing
It map the functionality in server based on client
No need to implement anything inside it
It execute middleware based on the mapping
Map function executes its middleware if the
request path mathces the string in the first
Map() is used for all types of request function
There are other mapping function like: MapGet,
MapPost, etc., that only used for a particular
The first param of a Map function is a string, and
it can have two parts: literal text, parameters
Literal text: is a fixed string that is meaningful to
Parameters: are text that is arbitrary to the
Server. It can be extracted using '{varName}'
Mapping String is Case senseless, meaning
upper and lower case are the same

path string matches the pattern in Map function

We can also constrain what type of data a

g.text: Controller is part of MVC(Model View Controller)
It handles routing & matches the correct action
Its purpuse is to group up a set of action based
It is a class that either postfix with "Controller"
before declaring the class so that
It is recommanded to create differernt Controller
It is a Service, so we need to add it to builder,
We can add all controller at once
A Controller can handle multiple routing using
Route(str) attribute, str indicates the URL path
Function that is right after a Route(str) attribute
is its Action function, an Action result must be
It is not recommanded to return a simple type.
Instead, it should return specific typ like
Types like ContentResult are built in action
result, ASP.NET will pick up this result type
and feed it to Response Object automatically
We make the Custom Controller Class derived
from Controller and let Action returns an object
Benifit of derived from this class is that we can
use many built in types and methods provided
in Controller Class and ControllerBase Class
This is the return type hierarchy:

g.text: It is the folder where client can access. All the
static files like icon, html, js, etc. should resides
Root Folder name by default is "wwwroot", but
It can be change in configuration
A project can also have multiple Root Folder. A
Requested file will first retreive from defautl root
We can return files in Action method. See
We can access css and js file in Razor View

performs particular functionalities. They do not
Examples are: Custom Controllers, Custom Binding

g.text: It parse the incoming data and match them to
It reads Request data in following order:
This means if the Reqeust contains two values
with the same variable name, then it will only
choose the one that has the higher preceding
// int number caught by the Model Binding
Model Binding is performed automatically, we
only need to specify what type of data each
Since Model Binding is automatic task by ASP
.NET, It will send apropreate value to Actions in
We can specify which part of the request an
Action would like to retreive data without
following the pre-defined preceding in Model
We can create a Model Class and provide it
in an Action method so that Model Binding can
automatically create this Class instance and
field up all instance's feilds using Request data
We can also provide MVC attribute before a
field member which indicates the source
There are two types of Form Data: One is from
We can put all the validation data inside this
Model Class so Action method in Controller can
A validation of a feild can be simply put a MVC
attribute enclosed in "[ ]" before the field
Required Attribute means it can not be null
We can define desire exception message
We can catch Model validation error in
// Loop through eacth fields of the Model
// Loop through errors for each field
There are a couple of different validation
The field is pass to the Required during
and Display sets the variable name to
We want to specify an Action to receive only
Also, We can put [BindNever] attribute before a
Model class property so that it is exclueded
data from Request body. It is raw data like JSON
and XML. An Action must specify this attribute if
it wants to parse raw data type
ASP.NET by default can only serilize JSON data
To enable XML serilization, we need wirte a
Class to do it. It is in Course 71
Provide Binding process instead of default
It allows you to bind a Binding Class to a Model
Class, so that ASP.NET automatically use
Binding Class rules and return a Model class
instance which is pass to an Action that requires

g.text: View is the 'V' in MVC, its responsibility is to
create a webpage that display html and data
We need to register in the service using builder
In Controller Action, when we return a View,
ASP.NET will automatically look for the View
Razor view has html part that is executed by
the client(browser), it also has C# code that is
For simple expression to access field variable
other data structure, we can just use @data or
C# code and expression is excuted when View
Model is prepared, final result will be pure html
and send it to the client
Razor View should not have many C# code
Razor View should be partial if LayoutView is
ViewData is prepared in Controller, then send it
to the View so that View can access ViewData.
Every .cshtml file is compile to a Razor View
Class that inherits Razor Page Class. That
means we can have class properties and fields
Variables in code block is not accessible in
All fields are private to that Razor View Class
Using it like class is not recommanded
ViewBag is a wrapper of ViewData. It allows
It is automatically created when VIewData is
It returns null if some property is not giving
It cast all ViewData to Object type. So we have
to know what we are using.
A Strongly Typed View is a View that receives
a Class Type Instance or instances
We can pass an Model Class instance to the
Receive it in View as 'Model'. We also need to
mention it at the start of the View
One Strongly Typed view can only bound to one
Model Class. However, we can wrap two or
more class instance in another class or parent
import all necessary Classes so that all other
Razor View files that are in the same folder or
child folder can automatically have them
A Razor View file will have all imported Model
class from all _ViewImport files in its hierarchy
Razor View files under /View/Shared folder can
An Action method that returns View first look for
that view in the folder that has the same name
as the Controller. If not found, it then go to the
Shared folder to look for the Razor View file

g.text: LayoutView contains the base of an HTML page
that get included for each Razor VIew
A LayoutView file should stored inside Shared
Razor Views are included at the place where
It contains Razor View not other way around like
View is executed first and then Layout View
Layout View can not be executed directly by
Razor View can added to a LayoutView
ViewData is shared because VIew is executed
Layout can be import dynamically with condition
automatically used by all View in the same
However, a View only added to the most recent
We can add Razor View in specific location in
Best usecase is to sperate JS files

g.text: Partial View is reusable view that can insert into
A PartialView file should stored inside Shared
Partial View content can be directly returned to
a Razor View using following way (Both Async)
Partial View content can also be streamed to a
client to boost the performance of loading
It is also an async process
Partial View automatically gets all ViewData
from Razor View. We cal also specify specific
data when include a Partial View
A Partial View cna be StronglyTyped View using
the same streatigy defined in View section
Partial View Result can be returned in an Action
method to handle dynamic fetching request
On click bottom, we can fetch data from specific
url that point to an Action method in Cotroller
that returns a Partial View Result
We do not need to include PartialView inside the
RazorView that fetches data. We can just use JS
to render it on a tag

g.text: View Component is a Class that returns a
it should inherit from ViewComponent Class and
It is an Async process that is non-blocking
It returns a PartialView type in location:
Razor View can add View Component
It is reusable and seperated from other part of
a project. That means it can be develop and
It can be utilized by Tag Helper
We can use ViewData to pass data to Partial
View, and it works just like how Controller pass
View Component can not receive data from
Razor View inheritenly. But we can send any
data in Razor View by passing
However, passing data requires all other Razor
View that included this ViewComponent to do
Recommand to use ViewBag inside a Partial
A Partial View cna be StronglyTyped View using
the same streatigy defined in View section
View Compnent Result can be returned in an
Action method to handle dynamic fetching
On click bottom, we can fetch data from specific
url that point to an Action method in Cotroller
that returns a View Component Result
We do not need to include ViewComponent
inside the RazorView that fetches the data.
We can just use JS to render it on a tag
Services in MVC are classes that handle
Invoke Data Layer to fetch data
It is advice to create a seperate project library
for Business Model so that it can be reused for
Since Service is a Seperate Project, we need to
add it to WebApp Project Reference by right
It is invoked in Controller of the WebApp
We should use Dependency Injection to create
To make the Dependency reusable, we should
apply Inversion Of Control principle and create
We create a IoC container to build a bridge
between WebApp and its dependency class
An IoC container should be Added to builder
//IoC container is an object of ServiceDescriptor
There are short method for eawch Lifetime
There are three liftime option for a Service:
After Registering the Service in WebApp, we
can declare the dependency instance to the
Controller constructor with the IInterface class
We can also inject the Service instance to an
Action method depends on the size of a project

g.text: Guid generates a unique hexidecimal serial
A Service will be dipose at the end of a scope
automatically. We can take control of it by
It is recommanded when handling database
query where we need to close the connection
The default Scope for a Service is in between
We can create a Child Scope and Inject Services
We first aks for a IServiceScopeFactory instance
We then open a child scope where we need it
We can inject Service instance in Child Scope
Services created inside a Child Scope will get
We can inject a Service inside a View without
When use Entitty Framework, we dont need to
use Dipose() to manually close DB connection
Storing Large Data in Singleton is error prone
since request is concurrent. If it is needed, use
or Redisfor any significant amount of data or
Don't use scoped services to share data among
services within the same request, because they
It is IoC container library for .Net Core that
provides addtional features when using IoC
InstancePerOwned: its lifetime depends on the

g.text: EnvironmentName: Gets or sets name of the
ContentRootPath: Gets or sets absolute path
true if the current environment name matches
We can use Injection to receive Environment in
We can use Injection to receive Environment in
constant key/value pairs that are set at a common
location and can be read from anywhere in the
We can set the application configuration variables
in many sources, and read it in our WebApp

g.text: We can Inject IConfiguration to Controller, and
Receive it in Controller Constructor. We then
access it like the two ways we used with "app"
Configuration key can have inner Sections
We can also store a GetSection result Section to
Create a Config Model Class that reads nessesary
Configuration Model Class should only have
Configuration Model Class properties name must
matche the key in the configuration
We can Inject Config Model Class as an Service
In Controller, we must inject IOptions Interface
By doing so, we only allow Controller to receive
configuration stated as the property of the Model
Class, but not the entire Configuration variables
We can putdown configuration in appsettings.json
Above are second level of app Settings. It override
the main appsettings.json for environment stated
Some inforamtion should only stored in developer
local machine outside of a proejct directory which
will not stored in sorce code and remote repository
We can access this secrets.json file by right click
on Project in sidebar and select "Manage User
It should not be used in Production environment

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 226px; height: 1px; padding-top: 6024px; margin-left: 2324px;

g.text: We can use terminal command to set up secrets
"dotnet user-secrets init": init a User Secret
Once initialized, a User Secret is generated a
secrets.json file in Microsoft folder with Guid
hexadecimal unique id as parent folder for the file
this sets a key value pair for User Secret
Regular terminal is one you opened from your
VS terminal is one you open by right click on your
Process level Environment Variables: In a VS
terminal, we can specify application environment
Benifit of using Process level Environment is
that these environment variables are only visiable
to that terminal, other terminal could not access
Process Level Environment are not gonna be
added to LaunchSettings.json, so we have to
disable it when we use PLE
between parent key and child key.
It is one of the most secured way of setting-up
We can also set configuration variables in Process
It overrides all settings metioned before
It is very private, but they are only visible for that
dotnet command can work in both Solution folder
Setting Process Level Environment is in Solution
To start up a project, we must be in Project folder
When our appsettings get too lengthy, we can
create a seperate evironment json file and add
"optional" field says if the custon.json file is
"reloadOnChange" field says if the DotNet project
should reload if the json file is modified
It overrides the default appsetting file

fetching data and re-render a html tag

g.text: We can create a route Action responsible of
fetching data and re-render a html tag
This Action returns a ViewComponent type
We do not need to attach this View Compinent
in the Razor View that performs fetch request
